posts.author: umbrellamonk
posts.content:
Edit: Hello, first time posting, though I've lurked intermittently for as long as the original ECB on, IGN was it?.

I've been trying to make a melee build that's got good AB, decent dev crit (DC40+), Pale Master defenses and access to at least epic warding, preferably also EMA.  I tried cramming dev crit into Valerfor's Andariel, but it proved to be too feat-starved.  Then I came across Grizzled Dwarflord's Charnel Lord, and it was exactly what I was looking for in a PM fighter build, except the AB was a little low.  So I took a rusty scalpel and shiny new hammer to it and here's what I came up with.  I've looked through he forums and text searched the downloaded ECB build index so I hope I didn't miss something.  I know Grizzled Dwarflord has a build with this exact spread (Myrmidon Eternal), but it turns out quite different (no dev crit, earlier PM levels, only one epic spell etc. etc.).

Combat Vitals:
AC: 38 (mundane plate)
AB: 42/37/32/27 (Any weap keeping dev crit in mind, I picked greatsword.  Man I wish falchions were in NWN1 >____>)
HP: 452
Resistances: Acid, 10/-
Immunities: All the Pale Master goodies i.e. immune to crit, paralysis, stun, holds
Fighty Abilities: DC41 Dev Crit, IKD, Improved Disarm, Improved Expertise, Power Attack

Saves
Fort: 26 (37)
Will: 21 (32)
Reflex: 19 (30)

Skills:
Discipline: 43(54)
Spellcraft: 43(45)
Taunt: 43(42)
Tumble: 43
UMD: 41(40)

The first 14 levels are more or less the same as Charnel Lord, with some feat order swapped around on account of personal preference.  I wanted to minimize pre-epic PM levels to eke out more AB, and at the same time didn't want to take one too many fighter feats pre-epic.  The order can probably be more optimized for playability.

I'm not building with any particular environment in mind.  Primarily PvM, but with all the combat abilities and defenses, only thing I see holding it back in pvp is the low AB.

I believe I can trade in Great Strength III and IV for one more epic spell and a free feat (either armor skin or ESF: Discipline I think).  That would bring AB down to 41 though and I dunno if any of the remaining spells are worth that tradeoff.

I've also got a version that takes PM down even further, to Fighter20/Bard4/PM16, leaving just epic warding in exchange for more AB and feats.  Might post it but I want to know if I'm on the right track first.  

I want to say I've done good here, but I can't help but feel that compared to Grizz's build that I started with, I've bartered away a lot of goodies for that extra bit of fightiness in the form of AB and fighter feats.  I dunno, am I overvaluing' AB here?

Again, I hope I haven't inadvertently copied some build out there I missed.  NWN been around so long that I find it hard to imagine there's something absolutely no one's tried before.

posts.author: umbrellamonk
posts.content:
Sorry for the double post...I just ran that build.  It's interesting, we kind of end up in the exact same place in terms of AC, strength, AB...everything.  In place of 4 pre-epic save feats (strong soul, great fort, iron will, lightning reflexes) I got improved disarm and improved expertise.  We also skilled up differently with the same number of points, but other than that I'm looking at the thing and the only difference at level 40 is Kail squeezed out 11 more hp!

Course, his also looks to be much more playable, especially from leveling from 20 onwards, but it's funny how these things can kind of converge XD
